PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Projeto INCT AmbTrop - Instituto Nacional de Ciкncia e Tecnologia em Ambientes Marinhos Tropicais
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: As regiхes Norte e Nordeste do Brasil, devido аs suas caracterнsticas, apresentam uma oportunidade ъnica para se avaliar de que maneira a heterogeneidade espacial e temporal dos ambientes marinhos tropicais influencia os padrхes de resposta destes ambientes e sua resiliкncia аs mudanзas climбticas que afetarгo a regiгo neste sйculo. Nesta regiгo, compreendida entre os estados do Espнrito Santo e Amapб, encontram-se as principais construзхes recifais do oceano Atlвntico Sul Ocidental, os principais deltas brasileiros, uma das бreas mais extensas de manguezais do mundo, uma plataforma continental que varia da mais estreita a mais larga do Brasil, as principais ilhas e montes submarinos, variaзхes extremas nos fluxos de sedimentos e nutrientes, alйm da sua importвncia inegбvel na transferкncia de calor e massa interhemisfйrica. Em sua concepзгo, o INCT AmbTropic estб estruturado em 3 Pacotes de Trabalho que contemplam as trкs escalas espaciais principais de investigaзгo. Cada um destes Pacotes de Trabalho se desdobram em Grupos de Trabalho (GT) que investigarгo aspectos especнficos dentro de cada uma destas escalas espaciais. A escolha dos temas dos Grupos de Trabalho e suas бreas especнficas de investigaзгo foram balizadas pelos seguintes principios: (i) contemplar a heterogeneidade espacial e temporal nas suas trкs escalas principais de investigaзгo, privilegiando gradientes fisico-quimicos e dinвmicos (ondas, marйs, CO2, circulaзгo, etc.) e ambientes marinhos intrinsecamente associados а regiгo tropical do Brasil, tais como recifes de corais, manguezais, recursos vivos, ilhas oceвnicas, processos oceвnicos etc., (ii) construir sobre a experiкncia dos grupos de pesquisa locais, (iii) concentrar os esforзos dos GTs em areas geogrбficas comuns, nгo sу para minimizar custos, como tambйm estimular a sinergia entre os GTs, e (iv) avaliaзгo de recursos naturais (vivos e nгo vivos) especнficos da regiгo

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: A Support Vector Machines-based Prediction Model for Ocean-Meteorological Precursors of Extreme Events related to Climate Change in the Southwestern Tropical Atlantic
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Abnormal behavior of ocean-meteorological (OM) variables, such as Sea Surface Temperature,
Sea Surface Height, Sea Surface Salinity, Sea Level Barometric Pressure among others, is an
important conditioning factor of climate variability and also they are precursors of extreme
events (for example, severe rainfalls) at the Southwestern Tropical Atlantic region. Thus, their
long-term prediction may anticipate the occurrence of such undesirable events and enable the
implementation of proper actions to minimize their devastating consequences. Therefore, it is
proposed in this work a long-term prediction procedure based on the data-driven approach
Support Vector Machines (SVMs). SVM emerged here as an alternative for solving this type of
problem due to two main reasons: i) although research efforts have been underway to extend the
number of moored arrays with data transmission based on satellite systems (which obtain realtime
measurements of OM variables), they have still shown to be too much expensive; ii) the
numerical coupled oceanic-atmospheric models often adopted to evaluate the OM system are
usually cumbersome and related to an increased computational cost, which may jeopardize the
model ability in providing forecasts in time. Thus, the SVM-based method will be tailored here
to forecast climate change related ocean-meteorological variables in the Southwestern Tropical
Atlantic. The learning phase of the SVM method will be based upon the knowledge on
environmental indicators which are monitored by buoys of the Prediction and Research Moored
Array in the Tropical Atlantic (PIRATA) Project. Data from PIRATA buoys, located at sites
with different climatic and oceanographic characteristics, will be used to feed the SVM model so
that the forecasts? accuracy may be evaluated as the number of years ahead increases.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Support Vector Machines for Detection of Operator?s Drowsiness Condition Based on Electroencephalographic Signals
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Concern regarding the potential negative effects of human performance in safety-critical
task environments has emerged. Indeed, recent studies have pointed out human errors as a primary cause for more than 70% of accidents. Therefore, it is imperative recognizing in advance high-risk states in operators so that to avoid the occurrence of accidents. In this context, one of the main aspects that influence operators? performance is their alertness level and brainwaves have shown valuable results on predicting the actual condition of the operator. In fact, it has been known that the brain offers reliable information to classify operator?s drowsiness level. Thus, the present project proposes a methodology via Support Vector Machines (SVM) to detect operator?s drowsy condition. One of the main advantages to use SVM is that it does not require previous knowledge about the process that maps input variables (brainwaves) into outputs (operator condition). The proposed classification methodology is offered by means of Electroencephalographic (EEG) signals. Moreover, this work also entails the application of the proposed methodological steps, by executing a data collection experiment and a spectral analysis of EEG signals in the context of a control room in an oil refinery. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento de modelo para previsгo de atividade de бgua a partir de nнveis de umidade na produзгo de raзхes da Adimax
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Atualmente, a empresa monitora a atividade de бgua de seus produtos (ex. raзхes) atravйs de aparelhos manuais que utilizam o ponto de orvalho na sua inferкncia. Esse procedimento й pouco apropriado devido a sua lentidгo e necessidade de intervenзгo de operadores para coleta e anбlise, diminuindo sua eficiкncia e capacidade produtiva. Ainda, se tratando da indъstria alimentнcia, o controle dos nнveis de garantia й ainda mais crucial. Variбveis relacionadas а composiзгo da raзгo (ex. proteнnas, fibras, material mineral) precisam ser supervisionadas, tornando ainda mais complexa a previsгo da atividade de бgua. Com o modelo de regressгo a partir da umidade e outras mйtricas, que serб elaborado neste projeto, serб possнvel inferir com acurбcia o nнvel da atividade de бgua do alimento, a partir de monitoramento realizado automaticamente em linha.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Development of a Deep Learning Method for Fault Diagnosis of Wind Turbines
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Despite the importance of wind energy power for the increase of use of renewable energy sources, the reliability of the wind turbines and their components is still an intricate issue. This situation is still intensified due to inefficient maintenance usually aggravated by technical and economic limitations associated to inappropriate inspection techniques. Indeed, there are some initiatives to develop and implement methodologies, technologies and procedures. However, most of them involve visual inspections performed by specialized personnel, subject to inspector?s experience and mental focus, making it highly prone to human error. In this context, our idea is to deploy a damage monitoring, diagnostic and prognostic technology for wind turbines based on the automated image processing and analysis of vibration signals, which can certainly contribute to overcoming the abovementioned deficiencies. Ideally, we aim at integrating this approach within an Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV), commonly known as drone, to significantly change how wind turbines are inspected and maintained. Therefore, we propose to develop a damage assessment methodology, which can be divided into three main levels: (i) Damage detection: detecting the presence of damage in the wind turbines; (ii) Damage localization and characterization: determining the geometric location of the damage and identifying the type of damage; (iii) Damage quantification and prognosis: quantifying the severity of the damage and predicting the Remaining Useful Life (RUL). From this perspective, this research project proposes to develop a reliable, efficient and autonomous approach for the inspection of wind turbines, which will extend their useful life and contribute to the increase of general safety levels.
